info.name: IMDb: Highlight 2016 releases nominated for Oscars
info.description: Provides highlighter-style background colors on links for films nominated for a 2017 Oscar (i.e., the 89th Academy Awards, to be held on 26 Feb 2017). Makes it especially easy to spot nominated films when browsing local theater showtimes on IMDb.
info.additionalInfo:
Links to the nine Best Picture nominees for 2017 are highlighted in green on IMDb. Feature-length films nominated in any other category are highlighted in yellow. Nominated short films are highlighted in orange.

Visit http://www.imdb.com/oscars/nominations/ to test that the highlighting is working properly, and to quickly spot patterns thanks to the color-coding. ("Hmm, Silence is the only Cinematography nominee not also nominated for Best Picture....") As an example of how it works in showtime listings, this is what's playing in Hollywood right now).

v1.0 (25 Jan 2017): Initial release. v1.1 (10 Feb 2017): Added ShortsHD theatrical packages for Animated & Live Action Short Films. (The two Documentary Short packages have no IMDb ID and can't be selected via pure CSS.)
